markdown:
<!-- PageNumber: 3 -->
<!-- PageHeader: Vocabulary -->

sleeve [sli:v]

Ärmel

In summer you wear shirts with short sleeves.

insect ['Insekt]

Insekt

In humid regions there are often lots of insects.
Fr. insecte (m)

*to bite [bart]

beißen; stechen

Does your dog bite? It looks a bit scary!

to carry ['kæri]

tragen

Can you carry this box for me, please?

sunscreen ['sAnskri:n]

Sonnencreme

The sun is shining. Don't forget to put on sunscreen.

rain [reIn]

Regen

Today there's a lot of rain and no sun.
rain → to rain → rainy

jacket ['dækıt]

Jacke

In summer you don't need a jacket.


![](figures/1.1)


hiker ['haıkə]

Wanderer/Wanderin

There are a lot of hikers in the mountains.

to pick up [,pIk 'Ap]

aufheben; abholen

There's paper on the floor. Please pick it up.

trash (AE) [træf]

Abfall; Müll

Don't throw your trash on the floor!
! trash (AE) = rubbish (BE)

ground [graund]

Boden; Erdboden

My phone fell onto the ground and broke.

*to smell [smel]

riechen; duften

The flowers smell wonderful.

to touch [tAtf]

berühren; antippen

Don't touch this dog. It could bite.
Fr. toucher

safe [serf]

sicher; ungefährlich

This bridge is too old. It isn't safe to use it.
safe ←→ dangerous

9 Find the odd one out!
[,faInd ði pd wAn 'aut]

Finde das Element, das nicht in
die Gruppe passt!

Find the odd one out: cougar - canyon - bear - coyote.

opposite ['ppezıt]

Gegenteil

What's the opposite of 'happy'? - 'It's 'unhappy'.

to replay [,ri:'pler]

erneut spielen; erneut abspie-
len

I didn't understand the dialogue. Could you replay it, please?

10 tidy ['taIdi]
sauber; ordentlich

Your room is always very tidy.

12 to try on [,trai 'on]
anprobieren

That's a nice shirt. Why don't you try it on?

fitting room ['fitin ,rum]

Umkleidekabine

Where are the fitting rooms? I'd like to try these pants on.

to fit [fit]

passen

These pants don't fit. They're too short.

perfectly ['p3:fiktli]

perfekt

This T-shirt fits perfectly. You look great in it.

13 sock [spk]

Socke

You can't wear these socks in those shoes. It looks terrible!

assistant [ə'sistnt]

Assistent/-in; Verkäufer/-in

I'd like to buy this jacket. Where's the shop assistant?


# Phrasal verbs

Here are some phrasal verbs. You must learn their meanings by heart.

to look
schauen

to take

nehmen

to take off

abheben

to turn on
einschalten

to turn up
auftauchen

to look forward to
sich freuen auf

to look out for
sich in Acht nehmen vor

to look up
nachschlagen


![](figures/1.2)


to turn
drehen

to look after
sich kümmern um

to look for
suchen

exampleSentence.valueString: In summer you wear shirts with short sleeves.
In humid regions there are often lots of insects.
This bridge is too old. It isn't safe to use it.
Your room is always very tidy.
Does your dog bite? It looks a bit scary!
Can you carry this box for me, please?
The sun is shining. Don't forget to put on sunscreen.
Today there's a lot of rain and no sun.
In summer you don't need a jacket.
There are a lot of hikers in the mountains.
Don't throw your trash on the floor!
My phone fell onto the ground and broke.
What's the opposite of 'happy'? - 'It's 'unhappy'.
Where are the fitting rooms? I'd like to try these pants on.
You can't wear these socks in those shoes. It looks terrible!
I'd like to buy this jacket. Where's the shop assistant?
There's paper on the floor. Please pick it up.
The flowers smell wonderful.
Don't touch this dog. It could bite.
I didn't understand the dialogue. Could you replay it, please?
That's a nice shirt. Why don't you try it on?
These pants don't fit. They're too short.
This T-shirt fits perfectly. You look great in it.

markdown:
<!-- PageHeader: 3 -->
<!-- PageHeader: Vocabulary -->


# Skills: How to find information on the internet

1
attraction [ə'trækfn]

Attraktion; Sehenswürdigkeit
The blob is only one of Green Moose Camp's attractions.
Fr. attraction (f)

display [dr'spler]

Vorführung; Ausstellung;
Schaukasten; Anzeige

At a flower show you can see a wonderful display of flowers.


# 8 Unit task: Our travel report

to paddle ['pædl]
paddeln

Let's paddle across the lake.

current ['kArnt]
Strömung

Don't go swimming here. The currents are dangerous.
Fr. courant (m)

to capsize [kæp'sarz]

kentern

Oh no! Our boat is going to capsize!

planet ['plænıt]

Planet

Aliens come from a different planet.
Fr. planète (f)

spaceship ['speisfip]

Raumschiff

In science-fiction stories people often
travel through space in spaceships.


![](figures/1.1)


*to go sightseeing
[,gəu 'sartsi:in]

eine Besichtigungstour machen
Let's go sightseeing in Chicago!

youth hostel ['ju:θ,hpstl]

Jugendherberge
A youth hostel is a cheap place where young people can stay.

key [ki:]

besonders wichtig

What were the key points of his presentation?


# 8 Story: You wanted an outdoor adventure!

countryside ['kAntrisard]

Land; Landschaft
We took a trip to the countryside. It was beautiful.
! in the countryside = auf dem Land, in der Natur

track [træk]

Spur; Fährte; Pfad; Bahn

Do you see these tracks? They are of a cougar.

to yawn [jo:n]

gähnen

I know you're tired, but please try not to yawn all the time.

*to tell sb to do sth
[,tel sambədi tə 'du: samθın]

jmdm. sagen, was er tun soll

Our teacher told us to read our texts again and look out for
mistakes.

tent [tent]

Zelt

I don't want to sleep in a tent. Let's go to a youth hostel.
Fr. tente (f); Lat. tentorium (nt)

*to go for a walk
[,gəu fer e 'wo:k]

spazieren gehen

It's nice today. Let's go for a walk.

against [e'genst]

gegen

It was against the rules to leave the camp at night.

to grab [græb]
greifen; ergreifen; schnappen

Holly grabbed her bag and left the house.

flashlight (AE) ['flæflart]

Taschenlampe

It's dark outside. We need flashlights.
An electric light that you can hold in your hand.


![0](figures/1.2)


pretty ['priti]

ziemlich; ganz schön

I think that's a pretty silly idea.

to tiptoe ['tiptau]

auf Zehenspitzen gehen

Shhh, you must tiptoe. Don't make any noise!

towards [te'wo:ds]

in Richtung

They went out of the house and walked towards the river.

much [matf]

sehr

A small flashlight doesn't help much.

<!-- PageFooter: two hundred and eighteen -->
<!-- PageNumber: 218 -->

exampleSentence.valueString: The blob is only one of Green Moose Camp's attractions.
At a flower show you can see a wonderful display of flowers.
Let's paddle across the lake.
Don't go swimming here. The currents are dangerous.
Oh no! Our boat is going to capsize!
Aliens come from a different planet.
In science-fiction stories people often travel through space in spaceships.
Let's go sightseeing in Chicago!
A youth hostel is a cheap place where young people can stay.
What were the key points of his presentation?
It was against the rules to leave the camp at night.
They went out of the house and walked towards the river.
I think that's a pretty silly idea.
A small flashlight doesn't help much.
We took a trip to the countryside. It was beautiful.
Do you see these tracks? They are of a cougar.
I don't want to sleep in a tent. Let's go to a youth hostel.
I know you're tired, but please try not to yawn all the time.

germanTranslation.valueString: jmdm. sagen, was er tun soll

exampleSentence.valueString: Our teacher told us to read our texts again and look out for mistakes.
It's nice today. Let's go for a walk.
Holly grabbed her bag and left the house.
Shhh, you must tiptoe. Don't make any noise!
It's dark outside. We need flashlights.

markdown:
<!-- PageHeader: Vocabulary -->
<!-- PageHeader: AC2 -->

to pretend [pri'tend]

vorgeben; vortäuschen; so tun,
als ob ...

Let's pretend we aren't scared.

to grunt [grAnt]

grunzen

Shhh! I think I heard an animal grunt.


![](figures/1.1)


wide [ward]

weit; breit; ausgedehnt

This trail isn't wide enough. You need to walk behind me.

calm [ka:m]

ruhig; friedlich

Stay calm and don't move!
calm←> nervous
Fr. calme

*to go on [,gəv 'on]

weitergehen; weitermachen;
weiterführen; fortfahren

Don't tell me how the story goes on. I want to read it.

to splash [splæf]

spritzen; platschen; planschen

A huge bear was splashing through the water.

backwards ['bækwødz]

rückwärts

There was no space to turn around, so we had to walk
backwards to get out of the cave.

to attack [ə'tæk]

angreifen

A bear attacked the hikers, but a ranger saved them.

statue ['stætfu:]

Statue; Standbild

Oh look, that's not a statue, it's a man!
Fr. statue (f); Lat. statua (f)

to lift [lIft]

heben; anheben; sich heben

Could you help me to lift this heavy rock?

stone [stəun]

Stein

Look out! There are big stones on the trail.

no wonder [neu 'wande]

kein Wunder

He only sleeps five hours a night. No wonder he's tired.

*to make sb do sth
[,merk sambədi 'du: samθın]

jmdn. veranlassen etw. zu tun

They made us tidy our cabin every day.

terrible ['terabl]

schrecklich; schlimm; furchtbar

Our youth hostel was terrible. It was very loud and dirty.
Fr. terrible; Lat. terribilis

1 realistic [,rıə'lıstık]

realistisch

Are your plans realistic?

realistic → real
Fr. réaliste


# Across cultures 2 Living together

1 ability [ə'bıləti]

Fähigkeit; Begabung

He's got lots of different abilities. He's good at sports, Maths
and singing.
Fr. habilité (f); Lat. habilitas (f)

well [wel]

gut

She loves singing but she can't sing very well.

statement ['steitmənt]

Aussage; Behauptung; Erklä-
rung

I'd like to make a statement.
to make a statement = to say something

advice (no pl) [ed'vais]

Rat; Ratschlag

What advice can you give me?

! He gave me two good pieces of advice.
Never: advices

<!-- PageFooter: two hundred and nineteen -->
<!-- PageNumber: 219 -->

germanTranslation.valueString: vorgeben; vortäuschen; so tun, als ob ...

exampleSentence.valueString: Let's pretend we aren't scared.
Shhh! I think I heard an animal grunt.
This trail isn't wide enough. You need to walk behind me.
Stay calm and don't move!
Don't tell me how the story goes on. I want to read it.
A huge bear was splashing through the water.
There was no space to turn around, so we had to walk backwards to get out of the cave.
Oh look, that's not a statue, it's a man!
A bear attacked the hikers, but a ranger saved them.
Could you help me to lift this heavy rock?
Look out! There are big stones on the trail.
He only sleeps five hours a night. No wonder he's tired.
They made us tidy our cabin every day.
Our youth hostel was terrible. It was very loud and dirty.
Are your plans realistic?
He's got lots of different abilities. He's good at sports, Maths and singing.
She loves singing but she can't sing very well.
I'd like to make a statement.
What advice can you give me?

markdown:
<!-- PageHeader: AC2 Vocabulary -->

What I'm good/bad at

I can/can't concentrate ['konsntreit]/listen for a long time/run very fast/hear/see
very well/...

..… mich konzentrieren …

I find it easy/difficult to learn things by heart/remember words/solve [splv] puzzles/
talk in front of people/write long texts/work with a computer/ask someone for help/
explain something to other people/be polite/friendly ...

... lösen …

I make/don't make a lot of mistakes when I ...

Cheering up [,tfiərın 'Ap] sad people/Helping people in trouble/... is easy/difficult for me.
… Trösten …

I am very/not very good/bad at sports/Maths/English/organising things/ reading/talking/
writing/singing/dancing/playing the guitar...

I'm scared of dogs/spiders ['spardəz]/ ... when I look down from a high building/
Spinnen...

when I'm alone at night/...

2 disability [,dısə'bıləti]

Behinderung; Unfähigkeit

At our school there are some students with disabilities.
ability → disability

physical ['fizıkl]

physisch; körperlich

I'm in a wheelchair because I've got a physical disability.

intellectual [,Intl'ektjuəl]

intellektuell; geistig

I sometimes play intellectual games on my phone.
intellectual → physical
Fr. intellectuel/-le

sign [saIn]

Zeichen; Schild

My brother can't hear. So we talk to him in
sign language.
Fr. signe (m); Lat. signum (nt)


![](figures/1.1)


guide dog ['gard ,dpg]

Blindenhund

A guide dog is a dog that helps people who can't see.

inclusion [in'klu:3n]

Inklusion; Einbeziehung

At our school, we believe in the idea of inclusion.

inclusive [In'klu:sIv]

inklusiv; einschließlich; umfas-
send

My brother learns more slowly than me. He went to a special
school, but now he is in an inclusive class at my school.
inclusive → inclusion

schooling ['sku:lın]

Schulbildung

Inclusive schooling is for children with and without
disabilities.

system ['sıstəm]

System

What are the differences between the American and the
German school systems?

to sign [sain]

unterzeichnen; unterschreiben

Please sign the letter before you send it.
Fr. signer; Lat. signare

right [rart]

Recht

Men and women have the same rights.

success [sek'ses]

Erfolg

The movie was a big success.
Fr. succès (m)

3 article ['a:tıkl]

Artikel; Bericht (in einer Zeit-
schrift, Zeitung)

On the TTS website there are lots of articles about clubs.
Fr. article (m)

cactus, ['kæktøs],
cacti (pl) ['kæktar]

Kaktus

A plant that doesn't need much water,
so it can even grow in the desert.
Fr. cactus (m)


![](figures/1.2)

exampleSentence.valueString: At our school there are some students with disabilities.
I'm in a wheelchair because I've got a physical disability.
I sometimes play intellectual games on my phone.
My brother can't hear. So we talk to him in sign language.
A guide dog is a dog that helps people who can't see.
At our school, we believe in the idea of inclusion.
He went to a special school, but now he is in an inclusive class at my school.
Inclusive schooling is for children with and without disabilities.
What are the differences between the American and the German school systems?
Please sign the letter before you send it.
Men and women have the same rights.
The movie was a big success.

germanTranslation.valueString: Artikel; Bericht (in einer Zeit schrift, Zeitung)

exampleSentence.valueString: On the TTS website there are lots of articles about clubs.
A plant that doesn't need much water, so it can even grow in the desert.
